pieces1.definition: This phase of the cell cycle includes G1, S, and G2 Phases.

pieces1.hint: A cell can be found in this phase for about 90% of its cell cycle.

pieces1.definition: In this phase, the cell is growing in preparation for DNA replication.

pieces1.hint: Initial 'growth' of the cell. This happens before the S Phase.

pieces1.definition: The phase in which DNA is replicated in preparation for cell division.

pieces1.hint: This phase 'makes' or 'synthesizes'. Happens before the G2 phase.

pieces1.definition: This phase is getting prepared for mitosis by carrying out rapid cell growth and creating proteins.

pieces1.hint: The 'get ready' stage, right before mitosis. Has an important check to make sure there is enough DNA.

pieces1.definition: This is the phase that carries out essential steps in cell division, including creating 2 identical nuclei.

pieces1.hint: Takes up only about 10% of the time of the cell cycle.

pieces2.definition: Phase in which chromosomes condense and paired chromatids become visible. The nuclear envelope disappears.

pieces2.hint: Prefix means before. First phase of mitosis.

pieces2.definition: Chromosomes line up in the middle under tension from the mitotic spindle.
Identical chromosomes are pulled away from each other towards opposite poles by the mitotic spindle.
Phase of mitosis in which chromosomes have moved to opposite ends of the cell and two nuclei are formed.

pieces2.hint: TWO nuclei formed. Cleavage gap formed, can see the beginnings of 2 cells forming.

pieces2.definition: The actual separation of the cytoplasm, which results in two individual identical daughter cells.

pieces2.hint: individual identical daughter cells, cytoplasm cutting
